Interface Screen

All Known Implementing Classes:
BuyingScreen, DayTradingBuyingScreen, DayTradingScreen, DayTradingSearchScreen, DayTradingSellingScreen, GraphingScreen, InvestmentSearchScreen, MainMenuScreen, SearchScreen, SellingScreen, SimulationScreen, SimulationsScreen
public interface Screen
The Screen interface defines the contract for all screen classes in the application. Any screen in the application that represents a user interface (UI) must implement this interface. The interface provides methods for drawing the screen, handling user input (mouse and keyboard), and setting up any necessary state or resources for the screen.

Classes implementing this interface must provide their own implementations for the methods defined below.

See Also:
  • DrawingSurface

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    void
    draw()
    Draws the graphical elements of the screen.
    void
    keyPressed()
    Handles the key press event.
    void
    keyReleased()
    Handles the key release event.
    void
    mousePressed()
    Handles the mouse press event.
    void
    setup()
    Sets up any necessary resources or state for the screen.

  • Method Details

    • draw

      void draw()
      Draws the graphical elements of the screen. This includes rendering buttons, text, and any other UI elements.

    • setup

      void setup()
      Sets up any necessary resources or state for the screen. This method is typically called once when the screen is initialized.

    • mousePressed

      void mousePressed()
      Handles the mouse press event. This method is called when the user clicks on the screen. The method should define what actions to take based on the mouse click, such as switching screens or interacting with UI elements.

    • keyPressed

      void keyPressed()
      Handles the key press event. This method is called when the user presses a key. The method should define what actions to take based on the key pressed, such as navigating between screens or triggering certain features.

    • keyReleased

      void keyReleased()
      Handles the key release event. This method is called when the user releases a key. This method can be used to reset or update the state of the screen based on key releases.
